respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)
respStmt.name: Matthew Holford

msItem.title: Account of miracles worked by Dominicans in Palestine as given to the general chapter at Utrecht in 1330

msItem.author: Laurence of Aquileia
msItem.title: Vsus dictaminis
msItem.rubric: Incipit paractica sive usus dictaminis magistri Laurencii de Aquilegia
msItem.incipit: Sanctissimo in Christo patri ac domino Domino Bonifacio divina providencia

msItem.title: Verses
msItem.incipit: Quod (sic) sancti Rome quot sunt miracula Thome

msItem.title: Document (copy) dated 3 Sept. 1321 witnessing the receiving by the episcopal curia of Paris of the bull Vas electionis of John XXII, with the text
msItem.note: (only the latter is pr. in Chartularium Univ. Paris. II. i p.243).

msItem.author: Laurence of Aquileia
msItem.title: Summa dictaminis
msItem.rubric: Incipit summa dictaminis breviter et artificiose composita per magistrum Laurencium Lonbardum iuxta stilum Romane curie et consuetudine [sic] modernorum et prout modernis placet
msItem.incipit: Noviciorum studia ianuam sibi concupiscencium aperiri dictatorie facultatis
msItem.note: The opening sentences are the same as those of the summa in MSS. Bodley 158, and Corpus Christi Coll. 55.

msItem.title: List of synonyms
msItem.note: Followed by a list of adverbs, and a few short letters

msItem.title: Visio Philiberti
msItem.note: ed. T. Wright, Poems attr. to Walter Mapes, pp.95–106, with an additional first verse as noted by H. Walther Das Streitgedicht p. 213 no.73
msItem.incipit: Est mortis hec condicio, qua spiritus superatur
msItem.explicit: Et me Christi manibus totum commendavi.

msItem.title: Formulary of dictamen
msItem.rubric: Incipit summa dictaminis sive paractica secundum modum curie principum et aliorum prout modernis placet
msItem.incipit: Ad habendum preclaram et dilucidam formam dictaminis
msItem.note: The first few paragraphs of the introduction are drawn from the Beumgartenburg formulary (Rockinger pp.725, 6). Many of the places mentioned in the letters and documents are in southern Austria and Friuli (cf. E.P. Goldschmidt cat. 100 p.10).

msItem.title: Formularies of dictamen
msItem.rubric: In hoc tractatu describit Cassidorus utilissimas particulas aive clausulas epistolarum quas elegit de [sic] rethorica Tulii
msItem.incipit: Primo do litteris assensitivis. Cum tempore necessitatis amicus probetur
msItem.note: The connection with Cassiodorus is not clear.

msItem.author: Henricus de Treviso
msItem.title: Dictamina
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt dictamina peritissiml Rethorici pie memorie magistri Heinrici regie civitatis Tarvisinensis [Treviso] doctoris
msItem.incipit: Elevata est disposicio sciencie supra cedros Lyband supra omne preter deum.

msItem.author: Amadeus de Regio
msItem.title: Dictamina
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt dictamina magistri Amandi de Regio
msItem.incipit: Occurit nobis ex porte vestra littera quedam que auctoritatum monita prefulget
msItem.explicit: et ad laurum eterne vite feliciter vos perducat
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit conieries dictaminum honestissime et specialissime excerptorum secundum usum modernorum artis retorice facultatis.

supportDesc.collation: 1(10), 2(8)–5(8), 6(10), 7(6), 8(8)–13(8), the quires numbered 1–13 at the top of the first leaf. Quires 1–3 have at the foot of the first leaf ‘primus (secundus, tercius) quaternus tabularum,’ and quires 4–8 are numbered I–V. On fol.106v ‘13 quaternos habet summa ista’

history.provenance: No. 439 in the Admont Stiftsbibliothek (cf. MS. Lat. misc. d. 66)
history.acquisition: Bought from E. P. Goldschmidt, cat. 100, no. 10, 1936.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian Library staff, revised by Peter Kidd and Elizabeth Solopova.
